solution_line_template: On their first day to the grand canyon, the family took half as many photos as the ones they have in the gallery, meaning they took 1/{first_day_divisor}*{initial_gallery_photos} = <<{initial_gallery_photos}/{first_day_divisor}={first_day_photos}>>{first_day_photos} photos.

The total number of photos if they add the ones they took on the first day to the family's gallery is {initial_gallery_photos}+{first_day_photos} = <<{initial_gallery_photos}+{first_day_photos}={after_first_day_total}>>{after_first_day_total}

On the second day, they took {second_day_increment} more photos than they took on the first day, a total of {first_day_photos}+{second_day_increment} = <<{first_day_photos}+{second_day_increment}={second_day_photos}>>{second_day_photos} photos.

After adding the photos they took on the second day to the galley, the number of photos will be {after_first_day_total}+{second_day_photos} = <<{after_first_day_total}+{second_day_photos}={final_total_photos}>>{final_total_photos}
